definition: to serve as a model for others (idiom)/to be a worthy teacher
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
teacher/master/expert/model/army division/(old) troops/to dispatch troops
surname Shi
wrist or pocket watch
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: You know best "role models" of weight.
sentences.chinese: 你最清楚“为人师表”的份量。

sentences.english: An instructor is a person of exemplary virtue, and a true example of his students.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该为人师表，他是学生学习的真实榜样。

sentences.english: The professor is. a paragon of virtue and learning.
sentences.chinese: 这位教授堪称为人师表。

sentences.english: They will abide by this code, be worthy of the name of teacher, and be modeled by their students.
sentences.chinese: 全校教师应遵守本守则，为人师表，做学生的楷模。

definition: instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
paragon of virtue and learning/exemplary character
to educate people (esp. morally)
to teach/to bequeath

to be strict with oneself
to teach (idiom); lit. to give moral and practical instruction
education for everyone, irrespective of background
family education/upbringing/to bring sb up/private tutor
to conduct oneself/to behave with integrity
personal integrity
lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person

moral character
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
